quote: Great minds are always feared by lesser minds.
author: Dan Brown

quote: Simplicity is the glory of expression.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: If you cannot do great things, do small things in a great way.
author: Napoleon Hill

quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: Happiness can exist only in acceptance.
author: George Orwell

quote: Not all those who wander are lost.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

quote: ... a mind needs books as a sword needs a whetstone, if it is to keep its edge.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: Once you’ve accepted your flaws, no one can use them against you.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: The man who fears losing has already lost.
author: George R.R. Martin

quote: Cruelty is a gift humanity has given itself.
author: Hannibal Lecter

quote: Our scars have the power to remind us that the past was real.
author: Hannibal Lecter

quote: Divine gift does not come from a higher power, but from our own minds.
author: Robert Ford

quote: Sometimes I felt the only way to endure this world was to laugh at it.
author: Robert Ford

quote: Isn’t the pleasure of a story in discovering the ending yourself?
author: Robert Ford

quote: Your mind is a walled garden. Even death cannot touch the flowers blooming there.
author: Robert Ford

quote: Obstacles are only obstacles until you move them out of the way.
author: John Greer

quote: We have free will, and with that comes great responsibility, and some times great loss.
author: Harold Finch

quote: Anyone who looks on the world as if it was a game of chess deserves to lose.
author: Harold Finch

quote: Sometimes your mistakes can surprise you.
author: Harold Finch

quote: Once we become predictable, we become vulnerable.
author: Harold Finch

quote: The most efficient way to lose in a fight is to act without knowing your enemy.
author: John Reese

quote: Sometimes, habits are there to protect you.
author: John Reese

quote: We learn from failure, not from success!
author: Bram Stoker

quote: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Nothing can come of nothing.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: All art is quite useless.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A man cannot be too careful in the choice of his enemies.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Nothing can cure the soul but the senses, just as nothing can cure the senses but the soul.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The only way to get rid of a temptation is to yield to it.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: There is always something infinitely mean about other people’s tragedies.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: There is nothing worse than a man who has lost his joy.
author: James Fitzjames

quote: Fear is a choice.
author: Cornelius Hickey

quote: You don’t need to remind me of my sins. Just never forget your own.
author: The Creature

quote: We long for that we cannot have.
author: The Creature

quote: The monster is not in my face, but in my soul.
author: The Creature

quote: No more let Life divide what Death can join together.
author: Vanessa Ives

quote: All sad people like poetry. Happy people like songs.
author: Vanessa Ives

quote: I have run from the darkness for so long, only to find myself in a place darker still.
author: Vanessa Ives

quote: There are things within us all that can never be unleashed.
author: Vanessa Ives

quote: Things are so rarely what they seem.
author: Vanessa Ives

quote: It’s hard to judge cruelty when you’ve never known kindness.
author: Igor Strausman

quote: Know, first, who you are; and then adorn yourself accordingly.
author: Epictetus
